data.title: Julie Andrews Online : Honors, Awards and Nominations
data.text:
Awards, Nominations and Honors

2009 ELLE's Women In Hollywood

L'Oreal Paris Legend Award Spring Sing 2009

The George and Ira Gershwin Award 2008 American Speech and Hearing Awards Ceremony

Annie Glenn Award National Best Books 2008 Awards Winner

Home: A Memoir of My Early Years Americans for the Arts' 2008 National Arts Awards

Lifetime Achievement 2007 American Academy of Neurology

Public Leadership in Neurology Award SAG Awards

Lifetime Achievement 2006 Humanitarian Award

One for the Heart 2005 Emmy Awards

Outstanding Nonfiction Series - 'Broadway: The Amerian Musical' (Won) 2004 Emmy Awards

Supporting Actress, Miniseries or a Movie - Eloise at Christmastime (Nominated) 2003 The Museum of Television & Radio's Annual Gala

Honored Julie and Carol Burnett 2001 Kennedy Center Honors

Lifetime Achievement Award The Julie Andrews Stage

Walt Disney Pictures rededicated Sound Stage Two as "The Julie Andrews Stage." Sound Stage Two is the location where Julie Andrews filmed Walt Disney Pictures' "Mary Poppins" and returned 37 years later to film Walt Disney Pictures' "The Princess Diaries." Society of Singers

Ella Award San Sebastian International Film Festival

Donostia Lifetime Achievement Award 2000 Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire 1999 Doctor of Fine Arts - Yale University 1997 American Theatre Hall of Fame Inductee 1996 Tony Award

Best Actress in a Musical - 'Victor/Victoria' (Nominated and refused nomination) Drama Desk Award

Outstanding Actress in a Musical - 'Victor/Victoria' (WON) 1995 Emmy Awards

Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program - 'The Sound of Julie Andrews' (Nominated) 1993 Drama Desk Awards

Outstanding Featured Actress in a Musical 'Putting It Together' (Nominated) Women in Film Crystal Awards 1989 British Academy for Film and Television Arts' special Tribute Award (BAFTA) 1987 Golden Globes Awards

Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture - Comedy/Musical -

'That's Life!' (Nominated)

Best Performance by an Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama -

'Duet for One' (Nominated) 1983 Academy Awards

Best Actress in a Leading Role - 'Victor/Victoria' (Nominated) Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'Victor/Victoria' (WON) David di Donatello Awards

Best Foreign Actress (Migliore Attrice Straniera) - 'Victor/Victoria' (WON) Hasty Pudding Theatricals

Woman of the Year (WON) People's Choice Awards

Film Acting (WON) 1981 Emmy Awards

Individual Achievement in Children's Programming - Performers (Nominated) 1980 Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - '10' (Nominated) 1979 Walk of Fame

Star on the Walk of Fame 1973 Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'The Julie Andrews Hour' (Nominated) Emmy Awards

Outstanding Variety Musical Series - 'The Julie Andrews Hour' (WON)

Outstanding New Series - 'The Julie Andrews Hour' (Nominated) 1972 Emmy Awards

Outstanding Single Program - Variety or Musical - Variety and Popular Music - 'Julie and Carol at Lincoln Center' (Nominated) 1971 Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'Darling Lili' (Nominated) 1969 Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'Star' (Nominated) 1968 Golden Globes Awards

Henrietta Award - World Film Favorite - Female (WON)

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'Thoroughly Modern Millie' (Nominated) Laurel Awards

Female Star (WON) 1967 Golden Globes Awards

Henrietta Award - World Film Favorite - Female (WON) Laurel Awards

Female Comedy Performance - 'Thoroughly Modern Millie' (WON)

Female Star (WON) 1966 Academy Awards

Best Actress in a Leading Role - 'The Sound of Music' (Nominated) Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'The Sound of Music' (WON) British Academy Awards

Best British Actress - 'The Americanization of Emily' (Nominated)

Best British Actress - 'The Sound of Music' (Nominated) Laurel Awards

Musical Performance, Female - 'The Sound of Music' (WON) 1965 Academy Awards

Best Actress in a Leading Role - 'Mary Poppins' (WON) Golden Globes Awards

Best Motion Picture Actress - Musical/Comedy - 'Mary Poppins' (WON) British Academy Awards

Most Promising Newcomer to Leading Film Roles - 'Mary Poppins' (WON) Laurel Awards

Musical Performance, Female - 'Mary Poppins' (WON) Grammy Awards

Best Recording For Children - 'Mary Poppins' (Album) (WON) 1961 Tony Awards

Actress (Musical) - 'Camelot' (Nominated) 1958 Emmy Awards

Actress - Best Single Performance - Lead or Support - 'Cinderella' (Nominated) 1957 Tony Awards

Actress (Musical) - 'My Fair Lady' (Nominated) 1955
